content: hello everyone why lock here and today
we're going to paint a miniature don't worry bill I'll take it from here today
bill it's going to pray oh hey does it need to be so loud yes I need to
be loud otherwise people can't hear me bill
I was thinking Space Marines does it need to be a Space Marine yes for the
Emperor okay fine calm down calm down in the
past I've painted an ultramarine a salamander a blood angel and Imperial
fist as you're feeling a little chaos see a Dark Angel pick your poison have
fun edge hottie until your fingertips bleed yes you've clearly never made my
dungeon tiles ok painting minis painting minions sound painting mayonnaise bra
all right so I'm going back to one of the most influential videos in my
history and mini painting and 40k in general which is mini axe heavy metal
salamander now I had bought a box of primary intercessors to mess around with
a base coated and shaded them but never finished them so when I use some purple
cleaner and soak one of these overnight in it next day with a toothbrush paint
comes right off first thing I'm going to do is use my pin vise and drill a hole
in each foot then take a paperclip straighten it out and snip two pieces
about an inch long these will be the pins then with some superglue
I prefer gel control super glue apply a dab at the hole and insert the pin it
drags that superglue along with it as you insert it about an hour later should
be fully cured also going to use some blue tack and some toothpicks to mount
the pauldrons and the arms so here's the parts and they're all ready to go just
stuck them into a bit of foam since this is a showpiece I'm gonna skip
priming and go directly to base coat and it will be warp stone glow into the
airbrush along with a couple of drops of flow improver and a couple of drops of
water so slow and steady as she goes light dusting passes and we end up with
this nice buttery smooth base coats by the way I apologize for my friend to
camerawork this episode I'm still learning how to use my new Nikon next up
Scott says to do all the black areas so that's the pauldrons the armor joints
the gun casing and so on now for something that's actually new to me a
recessed shade 50/50 mix of green and black washes normally I just shade the
whole marine and move on so this is my first attempt ever to apply a recessed
shade after a few minutes have figured out that with the right fine tip brush
you can actually load it heavier than you think with the wash and as you go
over those annoying like microscopic armor circuit lines capillary action
will draw the shade in here it is all done but prior to cleanup I did go back
after this and clean up with warp stone glow for all those lines onward to moot
green for the first edge highlight again new for me a normally dry brush but
there is no shortcut the fact is if you want to get above-average results on a
mini you must learn to edge highlight it is painful it is long but there is no
substitute so it's all about the right thinness just the slightest touch of the
brush tip in your water jar then bring it back and mix around on the pallet
with the paint with the right consistency it should flow onto those
edges but not be a wide and watery uncontrollable line then a 50/50 mix of
Moot green and flash gets yellow this is a selective edge highlight only going to
do the extreme points of the armor
and knock out the metallics I did plate mail for the gun and gold for the chest
Aquila and other symbols followed by washes a black wash on the silvery bits
and a very light amount of Ag Rex earth shade on all the gold a little more edge
highlighting to do here on the gun couple shades of gray on the black parts
and a silver on the metallic parts oh and got to do the eyes the eyes look at
this brush look at this stupid thing yeah now let's talk about the base I
took some bits of cork sheeting broke two small chunks and super glued them to
the base such that the feet will be on them when I use this Vallejo ground
texture and cover the lower area of the base building it up against the sides of
the corpse since it's kind of like a paste
I took the marine and dip the pins in white paint then touched it to the base
to leave two tiny white dots which indicate where to drill with my pin vise
which I did base the cork with black then dry brushed it with two Gray's very
simple apply it a yellow base coat to the ground texture using my airbrush
because I hate hate brushing yellow on the old-fashioned way I hate it then
with an orange a good healthy dry brush all over that yellow followed by a
lighter dry brush of red and finally a very faint dusting of black almost
non-existent this is the exact same scheme we used way back in episode 23
for the lava tiles so now I can insert the pins snip away their excess length
and apply a dab of superglue around those nubs to secure them in place
from there all that remains is to add the water transfer decals and we're
about to go to the table to see the final product but real quick some
reminders if you like what you're about to see please don't hesitate to hit that
like button subscribe reminders etc etc there is a link in the description below
from my Amazon storefront easy free way to support the channel if you want just
buy your stuff through that link and for all you 3d printers out there
why LOX crafting goods is sponsored by hero's hoard which has an excellent
range of high quality models including but not limited to Altru tiles lines
which are open lock compatible also check out my modules over on the DMS
guild and remember $3 patrons get free copies of all my releases so after seven
attempts I gave up on the decal that it just won't sit flat on that curved
pauldron so now I'll figure that out another time
anyway the objective here is to get box art quality results and I'd say I'm like
50% they're particularly proud of how the eyes came out this is the best I've
ever been able to get my Marines eyes looking edged highlights little sloppy
it is amazing how much is revealed by the camera up close like that compared
to tabletop because it looks great at 3 feet but up close like this you can see
those guys are really really good I don't think I could apply this on a
large scale if I were to do a full army it would take me like years to finish so
again thanks to Scott mini AK you should go over to his channel this is a
crossover event so he's building one of my things right now and his channel of
course go there and subscribe if you're into painting miniatures are interested
in it I think he he runs one of the 10 best miniature painting channels on
YouTube really cool recent work with nonmetallic metals if you liked this
particular project here's two more that you should go check out right now also
enjoy this month's community showcase and don't forget to subscribe and click
that Bell reminder icon I am why lock thanks for joining me and I'll see you
next time
